entry.title: Re: End-to-End Visual Inspection Process in SAP Digital Manufacturing
entry.content:
Hi Sunita, 

you need VI_Models_Admin for Manage Machine Learning Models and VI_Results_Admin for Manage Visual Inspection Results. Refer to https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-digital-manufacturing/operations-guide/granular-role-templates.

To train models, you require an additional role template ( VI_Model_Training) and you need to activate Premium AI in SAP DM. Refer to https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-digital-manufacturing/operations-guide/ai-functionalities-in-sap-digital-manufacturing

entry.title: Re: Understanding the Behavior of the Payment Block in th...
entry.content:
Hello @SatoMasayoshi 

The Payment Block in Manage Supplier Master (company code view) is a default setting that adds a payment-block key to new supplier items, excluding them from Manage Automatic Payments unless unblocked at the item level. It doesn‚Äôt change old items retroactively or stop postings. SAP Help Portal-Block Master Data - Customer & Supplier

If your goal is to prevent postings entirely, use a central posting block on the business partner

Block reasons or keys used on items are stored in ‚ÄúDefine Reasons for Payment Blocks‚Äù (configuration). SAP Help Portal-Changing Payment Block and Payment Method

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Restrict users from editing a parked invoice
entry.content:
Since:

  • You‚Äôre not using workflow,
  • You want to restrict editing parked invoices,
  • And the catalog SAP_FIN_BC_AP_INV_MGMT_PC is unavailable,

Here‚Äôs what you can do:

Look for catalogs like:

These catalogs may vary by tenant and release version. Use the ‚ÄúMaintain Business Roles‚Äù app to search for catalogs containing ‚ÄúAP_INV‚Äù or ‚ÄúINVOICE‚Äù.

In the Maintain Business Roles app, select the role assigned to restricted users. Go to Maintain Restrictions.

For relevant catalogs:

  • Set Write Access ‚Üí No Access or Restricted
  • Set Read Access ‚Üí Unrestricted

Use available Restriction Types like:

  • Document Type
  • Company Code
  • Posting Status (if available)

Since Invoice Status is not available, Posting Status may help distinguish parked vs. posted invoices.

If standard role restrictions are insufficient, consider custom Business logic via In-App extensibility, BAdI Implementation (if allowed in public cloud), Field Control or UI Adaptation to disable edit buttons based on status. These options depend on your edition and extensibility scope.

entry.title: Re: How to Create Material Document Movements with Refere...
entry.content:
SAP provides two key APIs for Material Document Posting

  • API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV (OData) Material Documents - Read, Create
  • MATERIALDOCUMENTCREATEREQUEST1 (SOAP) Material Document - Create 

You can build a custom RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) application or schedule background jobs that consume these APIs:

RAP App: Use API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV in your service binding to post GRs from a Fiori app or external trigger.

Background Job: Use the SOAP API for batch processing of GRs, especially for high-volume or scheduled operations.

Make sure to assign the correct communication scenario (SAP_COM_0108), Configure communication arrangements in the Communication Management app. Use Business Catalogs like SAP_MM_BC_INV_DOC_PROC_PC for role-based access

entry.title: Re: Automatic quantity confirmation via TAG
entry.content:
Hello Jair,

If the relevant quantity is provided via Tag form the automation equipment and is processed in a PPD, the intended use would be to call the SFC Complete API/Service directly in that PPD (or a second sub-PPD if required). the POD can be subscribed to SFC Events and will automatically update the displayed quantities (in work and completed).

But maybe this is not the process you intend to implement? Maybe you want only want to provide the quantity to the operator and they should then manually trigger the next steps on the POD? than maybe you could use the machine input to start this poartial quantity via the SFC Start API/Service.

Let me know if this helps or if I went in the wrong direction.

Best regards, Michael

entry.title: Re: A production order compnonent material 101 mvmt displ...
entry.content:
In MB51, double-click the material document. Check the reference document. Is it linked to a production order, purchase order, or other document? Look at the document header ‚Üí field Reference Document (AUFNR) or Order Number. If the reference is not a production order, the movement may have been posted manually or via another process (e.g., MIGO, MB1A).

Go to CO03 ‚Üí enter the production order. Navigate to Component Overview. Check if the material is listed as a component. If yes:

  • Look at the withdrawal status and movement history.
  • If no movement is recorded, the 101 movement may not be linked to this order.

entry.title: Re: Changing supplier address when creating a purchase order
entry.content:
Hello Nikhil,
Kindly note that the "Address" tab in  PO header,  will show the vendor address from the BP .  However if you would like to use a different address, you could edit the address details manually in the 'Create Purchase Order' app and the respective change will be saved as a new address number .  
In any case it would not be possible to retrieve an already saved address.

Hope this helps!!

Thanks & Regards,
Vivek.

entry.title: New How-To Guides for Adapting Floorplan Manager Applications in SAP S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
In this blog I would like to draw your attention to two new How-To Guides that explain in detail how to create, enhance, and adapt Floorplan Manager (FPM) applications in the latest SAP S/4HANA releases.

Many SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud UIs are based on Floorplan Manager for Web Dynpro ABAP. This proven UI technology continues to play an important role in SAP S/4HANA 2025 and provides powerful capabilities for customer-specific adaptations without modification.

1. How to Create, Enhance, and Adapt FPM Applications for SAP S/4HANA 2025 (On-Premise and Private Cloud Edition)

This guide, valid for SAP_UI 8.16 (delivered with ABAP Platform 2025 as part of SAP S/4HANA 2025), provides a comprehensive overview of the different options that Floorplan Manager offers for customer adaptations and discusses their advantages and drawbacks.

It covers in detail how to:

  • Create and structure an FPM-based application

  • Adapt applications using Customizing, Enhancement, Deep-Copy, and Context-Based Adaptations (CBA)

  • Use the FPM Application Hierarchy Browser and FLUID (Flexible UI Designer)

  • Apply best practices to choose the right adaptation technique for your scenario

With ABAP Platform 2025, the guide also introduces updates to the FPM Mobile Enabler and improved transport handling for Context-Based Adaptations (CBAL/CBAS objects).

Download the guide (PDF)

2. How to Adapt Floorplan Manager Applications as of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508

This second guide focuses on adaptation options available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Release SAP_BASIS 916 / S/4HANA 2508).

It explains how key users (with role SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC) can adapt FPM applications via:

  • Customizing using the Adapt UI function

  • Context-Based Adaptations (CBA) for role- or device-specific variants

  • Transport of adaptations using Software Collections via the Export / Import Software Collection apps

The document includes step-by-step examples on how to simplify an FPM application and make it responsive for mobile devices using CBAs and the Device Type dimension.

Download the guide (PDF)

Both documents have been updated for the 2025 releases and provide a consistent, hands-on overview of the adaptation capabilities of Floorplan Manager in both On-Premise/Private Cloud and Public Cloud environments.

entry.title: How Can Predictive Maintenance in Dynamics 365 Field Service Be Optimized Using AI and IoT Data ?
entry.content:
Hi all, I‚Äôm currently managing a multi-site field service operation and exploring ways to leverage Dynamics 365 Field Service to its full potential. We have numerous assets deployed across different locations, and downtime is significantly impacting our operational efficiency.

I‚Äôm particularly interested in understanding how we can use AI-driven predictive maintenance combined with IoT sensor data within Dynamics 365 Field Service to:

Automatically predict equipment failures before they occur.

Prioritize work orders based on asset criticality and risk.

Optimize scheduling and dispatching for technicians across multiple sites.

Integrate predictive insights into our existing dashboards for real-time decision-making.

Has anyone successfully implemented a setup like this? What are the best practices, pitfalls, or advanced configurations (including custom workflows, AI models, or Power Automate integrations) that you would recommend to maximize uptime and reduce emergency maintenance costs?

Any insights, case studies, or architectural suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: Access CDS Objects Exposed as SQL Services Using Microsoft SQL Server
entry.content:
Hi,
we are still stepping in the dark. The trace looks fine. Only at the end it is somehow corrupted.
We have discovered an RFC bug that caused intermittent problems when the ODBC driver was used in HANA SDA and will publish a new driver patch shortly. I hope that this RFC bug fix will also fix your intermittent problems.

If the new driver patch does not help we may need to look at an RFC trace. To activate the RFC trace you need to set the following property in the connection string ( RfcTrace=debug ). This is our last resort since the RFC trace is very verbose and may write a large amount of data.
Regards
                   Frank

entry.title: Re: Report on SAP Signavio Process Intelligence data using the new OData API and SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
A small adjustment is required if the odata view exposes durations using the signavio data type Duration.

This becomes an odata data type Edm.Duration which is incorrectly mapped to Timestamp in Datasphere and generic in SAP Analytics cloud.

You should apply the function DURATION_TO_MILLISECONDS in the odata view and avoid the headache üôÇ

entry.title: Event-Based Revenue Recognition ‚Äì New target navigation to Project Financial Booklets
entry.content:
What's New?

With the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2602, SAP has introduced a target navigation from the monitoring app Event-Based Revenue Recognition ‚Äì Projects (F4767) to Project Financial Booklets . This update improves the reporting capabilities for project margin, costs, revenue, and planning data.

This enhancement allows users to access detailed financial insights directly from the object page of the monitoring app via the Related Apps dropdown menu.

Context-Sensitive Navigation

The target navigation is dynamically determined based on the project type:

  • For Project-Based Services (CPM projects), the system proposes navigation to: Project Financial Booklet ‚Äì Professional Services (F7479)
  • For Project-Based Sales (EPPM projects), the system proposes navigation to: Project Financial Booklet ‚Äì Enterprise Projects (F8698)

Visual Examples

Here are examples of how the navigation appears for each project type:

Professional Services Booklet

Enterprise Projects Booklet

entry.title: Re: Error Message QA495 during MIGO - Unable to move insp...
entry.content:
Hello @Sidram 

The root cause of the issue (it is not really an error) is the fact that your material is QM managed. Therefore any postings changing quality stock of the material has to be executed from QM level. That's exactly what the message says. That restriction is to keep MM and QM data consistent.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Error Message QA495 during MIGO - Unable to move insp...
entry.content:
Why you see the error message QA495 is because, when inspection type 01 (goods receipt inspection for purchase order) is active in the material master, SAP expects all inspection stock movements to be handled within the QM module, not via inventory transactions like MIGO or MB1B. Movement type 321 is valid, but only when triggered automatically after a usage decision is made in transaction QA11 or QA32.

To fix this, use transaction QA11 (or QA32 for mass processing), Enter the inspection lot number, Make the usage decision (e.g., "Accepted"), In the stock posting tab, choose to move stock to Unrestricted and save the decision ‚Äî SAP will automatically post movement type 321.

Go to mm02 for that material and navigate to QM view. Confirm that inspection type 01 is active. If you want to allow manual movement, you‚Äôd need to deactivate inspection type 01 ‚Äî but this is not recommended unless you're changing your quality process.

entry.title: Selecting service plan for SAP Ariba Central invoice management
entry.content:
Hi all

We want to have Peppol e-invoicing solution in Germany.

Invoice flow for inbound invoices will be Supplier > Peppol Network> DRC > SAP Ariba CIM > S/4 HANA Public cloud.

During integration, we need to choose suitable service plan for SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management (CIM).

CIM and S/4 public cloud integrate seamlessly and are covered under scope item 4N6.

When read set up instructions for 4N6, it says that the set up by booster by default chooses service plan as ''scim''.

https://help.sap.com/docs/link-disclaimer?site=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.sap.com%2Fcontent%2Fdam%2FSAAP%2FSol_Pack%2FS4C%2FLibrary%2FSetup%2F4N6_Set-Up_EN_XX.pdf

 

however, in the Peppol integration SAP content , it asks us to choose CIM service plan as ''Inbound - drc''

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-edition/sap-document-and-reporting-compliance-cloud-edition/integrate-cloud-edition-with-sap-s-4hana-cloud

Whereas a BTP account global administrator or a person setting up the system, when he accesses SAP BTP cockpit, he sees below service plans to choose from - 

Thus getting very much confused about which plan to choose from.

Another question is - in set up instructions 4N6, it clearly says that there are 2 licenses viz. a) SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management and b) SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management, Inbound Processing Module.

I want guidance upon on what basis we can decide whether to take Inbound processing module license or not to take...what are its specific uses which are not included in SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management license.

Help in this regards will be greatly appreciated..

Note - I have been reading lots and lots of content related to SAP ARiba central invoice management from SAP but not getting answers to my queries.

Regards

Megha

entry.title: Crystal reports + zebra cut options
entry.content:
A customer uses Crystal reports for printing labels, these labels comes within a batch of serveral copies.  The bought a zebra printer with cutting option. The want to cut the label after the last print of the batch. Within Bartender this is working, but when we're printing form crystal reports, every label is cut.

We tried in the driver the followin command befoer and after printing

Before:   ^XA^MMD^XZ (setting the printer in delayed cut setting)
After last page/printjob:    ~JK (the cut command)

After the printjob is finished, no cutting action is placed. The labels will be cut when the next batch is printing. 
Anybody got a suggestion to fix this?

entry.title: Re: A production order compnonent material 101 mvmt displ...
entry.content:
Check the IDOC type and processing function module (e.g., MBGMCR, MBGMCR03). Confirm whether the IDOC is configured to trigger automatic confirmation or just goods receipt. Look at WE02/WE05 for the IDOC status ‚Äî was it fully processed (status 53)?

In CO03, check:

  • Component Overview: Is the material flagged for backflush?
  • Control Key in routing: Does it allow automatic confirmation?
  • Confirmation parameters: Is auto-confirmation enabled?

If the component is marked for backflush but no confirmation occurred, check if work center or routing is missing backflush settings. Confirm that movement type 101 is correctly linked to the operation.

If IDOC triggers a BAPI (e.g., BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE), check whether confirmation logic is included. Look for any custom enhancement or user exit that might be suppressing confirmation.

entry.title: Re: Integrating SAP SuccessFactors with SAP Build Process Automation via SAP Cloud Application Event
entry.content:
Hi @emanuil_ivanov @acharyaw @EsmeeX 

We have an incident raised with SAP and the feedback we received is as follows: 

UCL is not able to process SF ORD because of an issue which was fixed as part of an internal fix. 

  • This fix is part of 2511 release of SF. That means it's still not available in this your environment. It will be deployed to preview environments this month (October) and to prod environments next month (November).

    As per our understanding, you are trying create "Events" project in SAP BPA. Here, if you use UCL as source, you don't see any events because of this error in processing SF ORD. 

    But as a workaround, you can use "SAP Business Accelerator Hub" as the source instead of Unified Cloud Landscape.

Hoping this works with the 2511 release üòê

entry.title: API for Product Availability
entry.content:
Hi,

we are running S/4Hana 2022 FPS01 and I was searching the Product Availability Service on api.sap.com. The services on api.sap.com lead me to this help page:  https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/15f9e51998a945cc82545cb6b4dbe5c2/ba15d698dd474a57ad340f9acff13b99.html?version=2022.001

Basically there ate two APIs available on our release:

- Basic Product Availability Service -> The product availability information is calculated according to the default Available-to-Promise (ATP) logic and is influenced by the configuration applied in your system.

- Product Availability Info Service: no reference to which ATP version is used within the service implementation...

Does/Should any of these APIs use basic ATP in the background, since we still do not use aATP... Once I try them, I always get response that we are not using aATP... I found even this Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/two-apis-to-retrieve-availability-information/ba-p/13576755

where it might looks like there is always aATP in the background...

If this is the case, is there any other API which still utilize ATP?

BR,

Milan

entry.title: SuccessFactors Microsoft Teams App Major Updates for 2H 2025
entry.content:
Feature Name Update in What‚Äôs New

To help you find the right feature more efficiently in the What‚Äôs New, we‚Äôve changed our Feature Name from ‚ÄúWork Tech‚Äù to ‚ÄúWork Tech (Microsoft Teams Integration)". See below screenshot:

Feature Switch Available

This is a highly requested feature by many customers. We have a lot of quick actions and notifications/approvals in our Teams app. Some customers might only want to start with part of them and then gradually enable more, not all at once. Now with this enhancement, we'll add the Switches for quick actions and notification cards, to provide flexibility to control which quick actions/ which approvals to be on/off based on your own company's strategy. See more details in the What's New.

It's quite easy to do the configuration, just go to Admin Center > Work Tech Configuration > Settings > SAP SuccessFactors APP in Teams. 

Note:

  • If a specific quick action is turned off, the action from the quick action list card and home tab will not be displayed, and user cannot trigger it via command in the chatbot as well.‚Äã
  • If a specific notification/approval card is turned off, it will not be sent to users‚Äô chatbot as a reminder. But the historical cards remain there.
  • We have Quick Actions/Notification cards that are reused from SuccessFactors Home Page side. For those cards, if the card is disabled in Manage Home Page, it will be displayed as switched off and cannot be turned on in Work Tech side. So in order to use the same card in Teams App, go to Manage Home Page to enable it first if the card exists in Home Page. But if it's enabled in Home Page of SuccessFactors, you can freely turn it on/off specifically in Teams side. ‚Äã‚Äã

 

Long-Time Login Enhancement

Previously, users might be frequently asked to log in to their SAP SuccessFactors account when using some quick actions or accessing the Home tab (almost every 30 minutes based on SuccessFactors side session). We fully understand the concern and worked with our authentication team together to get it resolved finally.  With this enhancement, users can keep logged in for up to 3 months without needing to re-authenticate. And this is supported in both the desktop and mobile clients of Microsoft Teams. See more details in the What's New.
The only pre-condition is - The Identity and Access Management solution is enabled in your company.

Note:

  • The refresh token expiration time (3 months) cannot be set in the sub-application in IAS due to IAS current capability. It is entirely controlled by the parent. So after 3 months, user need to re-login again, then it will keep another 3 months again without login.
  • We'll start the enablement of this enhancement from mid Oct, not based on the code release cycle as it's controlled by a feature toggle so we'll enable as early as possible to improve your users' experience.

‚Äã

Reference

  • E2E Demo for major features
  • Demo Recording for how to enable the App
  • Guide for how to enable the App

entry.title: dynamic break configuration not working for a second break after 6 hours & 44 minutes work time
entry.content:
Hi, 

We are trying to implement dynamic break configuration with below criteria:

1. If Working Time is equal or less than 4 hours and 14 mins, no breaks should be created.

2. If Working Time is equal to 4 hours and 15 mins up to 6 hours and 44 mins, 15 mins break should be created.

3. If Working Time is equal to 6 hours and 45 minutes up to whatever hours, additional 30 mins break should be created.

With total accumulated break of 45 mins.

Question: why the dynamic break is not created for criteria #3? when the dynamic break configuration is correctly set as:

Working Time duration: 6:44 (hh:mm)

Accumulated Break in minutes: 45

Thank you! appreciate any comments on this question!

entry.title: Re: pricing error: Mandatory condition ttx1 is missing
entry.content: The error is self explanatory.  TTX1 is a tax condition type which is set to Mandatory in your pricing procedure and for this condition type, no condition record is maintained in VK11.  Either you need to set as Optional instead of Mandatory depending upon the Business requirement or have to maintain condition record in VK11

entry.title: Re: Capturing 2 STIP EMP group on Worksheet in SAP SF VPay
entry.content:
Hello!

You have the aggregated totals worksheet when you first open the form and then you‚Äôll see the assignment details when you expand and this is where you find each change throughout the year. This should be what the customer wants and with some further training, hopefully, they‚Äôre able to adopt this level of design. 

There is no clear path way to what you want to do but, if you really need then, the two options I would consider;

- a custom field (or 2) that shows ‚ÄúLast STIP Assignment‚Äù and ‚ÄúPrior STIP Assignment‚Äù in the employee profile with an onChange business rule to populate the data when the primary STIP assignment is changed. The limitation is the volume of field you will be willing to have on the profile will limited the amount able to reference in the worksheet.

- to export the data via a report and load into a look up table for referencing. Limitation here is the quantity of employees, wouldn‚Äôt expect this approach to be very admin friendly.

 

Xavier might have some higher quality input here?

entry.title: Global "404 Not Found" Error During "Establish Trust" on All New BTP Trial Accounts (US &EU) Regions
entry.content:
"Hello Community,

I am reporting a persistent and reproducible error that is preventing the setup and use of all new SAP BTP trial accounts.

The Issue: The automated 'Establish Trust' process fails consistently with a '404 Not Found' error, which prevents the subscription of key services like SAP Build that require an OIDC trust.

Critical Evidence:

  • This is a global issue, not regional. I have provisioned separate, new trial accounts in both the US and European regions. The exact same error occurs on both, proving a systemic failure.

  • Error Message: (404 Not Found: "{"error":"Error during communication with IAS. Error was: 404 Not Found: \"{\"details\":[],\"error\":{\"code\":404,\"message\":\"<html><head><title>404 Not Found<\\/title><\\/head><body><br>404 Not Found - You did not enter a valid URL.<\\/br><\\/body><\\/html>\",\"target\":\"/tenant/registry\"}}\". Incoming request GET, /iastenants/g!c22e1c11-8835-463f-a5c7-4633513b12b5","uri":"/iastenants/g!c22e1c11-8835-463f-a5c7-4633513b12b5"}"(Correlation ID: 4bafd65c-b674-4e0a-6549-db3215514c9f)).

  • Correlation ID: (4bafd65c-b674-4e0a-6549-db3215514c9f).

Standard troubleshooting (cache clearing, multiple browsers, retries) is ineffective as the root cause is at the platform level. This is likely affecting all new trial users worldwide.

Can this report be escalated to the BTP Core Services or SAP Identity Authentication team for immediate investigation? Thank you."on clicking "Establish Trust" button

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere - Replication Flow (Delta Functionality)
entry.content:
@AnuragPakhidde Apologies for the delay in response, i had issues with my account login.

CDC mechanism will work with SAP BW ADO's, pre requisite is to DMIS add on to be installed in BW system and ODP configuration is enabled.

ADSO can be consumed to Datasphere through Replication flow with 'Initial' and 'Initial and Delta' options, recently SAP launched 'Delta' option and it works almost like 'Initial with Delta'.

HCPR can be used in Replication flow, but Delta feature will not be available. As Delta feature will based on request id and change log table, both features not available in HCPR.

Note: Even any ADSO without change log table also cannot perform delta transfer to Datasphere.

Creating CDS view on HCPR with Delta annotations would be option which i still need to explore, it would be great if it works. Please let me know the outcome if you have implemented this solution.

Thanks

Lokesh

entry.title: Re: How to call public cloud SAP API from embedded steamp...
entry.content:
Since the question keeps popping up, I've just recreated the scenario to be sure it still works. In this case based on the Product API.

< ! > Development in Eclipse is done in the development client.

< ! > Configuration in Fiori is done in the customizing client.

In Eclipse:

  1. Create a custom class for testing. The class should implement if_oo_adt_classrun to be able to manually run it.
  2. Create an outbound service (ZOBS_PRODUCT_REST, the _REST is added autmatically) of type HTTP Service and use the path found for the service:
  3. /sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_product/srvd_a2x/sap/product/0002/
  4. Create a communication scenario (ZCS_PRODUCT) and add ZOBS_PRODUCT_REST as an outbound service. Don't forget to Publish Locally, using the button in the upper right.
  5. Now create a Service Consumption Model (ZCM_PRODUCT) of type OData and provide it with the Service Metadata file downloaded earlier. It will ask you what entities to create, simply 'Product' will suffice for now. SAP will then supply you with example coding to call the service. Read is the easiest and enough to prove it works, so of course that's what I use here üôÇ
  6. Copy the example coding to the 'main' method in the custom class. Now it only needs the communication objects we've created.

In Fiori:

  1. In the Fiori Launchpad, make sure you add a communication user user for the system, both inbound and outbound.
  2. Create a communication arrangement based on communication scenario SAP_COM_0009 (Product).
  3. Open that arrangement and download the Service Metadata file (PRODUCT_0002.edmx) from the Product service.
  4. Create another communication arrangement based on the communication scenario we created (ZCS_PRODUCT) and set it for the same system and with the same user as the inbound arrangement.

Back to Eclipse:

Adjust the example code copied from SAP to include our specific objects:

" Create http client
DATA(lo_destination) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement(
                                                       comm_scenario  = 'ZCS_PRODUCT'
                                                       service_id     = 'ZOBS_PRODUCT_REST' ).
lo_http_client = cl_web_http_client_manager=>create_by_http_destination( lo_destination ).

lo_client_proxy = /iwbep/cl_cp_factory_remote=>create_v4_remote_proxy(
  EXPORTING
	 is_proxy_model_key       = VALUE #( repository_id       = 'DEFAULT'
										 proxy_model_id      = 'ZCM_PRODUCT'
										 proxy_model_version = '0001' )
	io_http_client             = lo_http_client
	iv_relative_service_root   = '' ).

 And a but further set the key we want to retrieve data for:

" Set entity key
ls_entity_key = VALUE #(
		  product  = '3' ).

Now make sure you open the class in the customizing client, set a breakpoint and execute it using F9.

In case the first call ends up in the exception, something in the configuration is off.
Otherwise, after the get_business_data method, the ls_business_data structure should contain the requested data!

entry.title: Re: Invalid char # replacement
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

You may want to try to modify your code and use UTF-8:

DATA(rv_data) = cl_bcs_convert=>xstring_to_string(
  iv_xstr = lv_xstring
  iv_cp   = 'UTF-8' ).

Please also check XString.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Thanks for a great Planning Excellence event 2025! We've got a new exciting Customer Conversation:
entry.content:
Dear Community,
 
Join us for an insightful Customer Conversation with ORKLA on their SAP IBP journey!

üåü This session is exclusively intended for SAP customers.

 
 
üì¢ SAP IBP @ ORKLA  

 

Date: Thursday, November 06, 2025 

Time: 16:00 (CET) I 10:00 (EDT) I 20:30  (IST) 

Event Duration: 1 Hour

Host Industry: Agribusiness

Event Language: English

 

Event Speaker:

Mr. Christian Hjerp - Solution Architect

 

 
üìç Register Here !

Dear Customer,

We are pleased to offer an exclusive opportunity for you to SAP Customer Conversations LIVE Event hosted by Orkla regarding their SAP IBP project. Learn directly from Solution architect, Christian Hjerp about the implementation of IBP and Orkla's SAP journey.

 

About: 

ORKLA ASA is a leading industrial investment company. The company produces and sells a range of branded consumer goods and concept solutions primarily to grocery and out-of-home sectors and adopted and implemented most modules of SAP Integrated Business Planning. The Norwegian company has a long-term, industrial approach to its 10 portfolio companies. Orkla invests in companies where they can contribute to further value creation through their industry expertise, consumer insight and experience in building leading brands.

 

Agenda:

  • Host Introduction
  • Orkla‚Äôs presentation
  • Initial Business Challenges
  • Why Orkla selected SAP IBP
  • SAP IBP System & integration overview
  • SAP IBP & SAP S/4HANA synchronized planning
  • Planning setup: implementation timeline, best practices & lessons learnt
  • Solution benefits for the company and for end users
  • Future roadmap

SAP Solutions:

Orkla‚Äôs SAP journey started in 2016-2017 with a roll-out of IBP. Orkla has several different SAP solutions and planning areas being rolled out with SAP IBP + SAP S/4HANA.

 
 
SAP Event Owner:
 

Maria Isabel Fern√°ndez I maria.isabel.fernandez@sap.com 

 

Nordics, Baltics & Belux Reference Field Engagement Manager
Customer References, EMEA/MEE / Global Field Marketing and Experiences, SAP
 
 
SAP Customer Conversation LIVE Events
 
A Reference Customer presents an SAP use case, implementation highlights, and achievement of business results, followed by a LIVE discussion and interactive Q&A.
 
*This session is exclusively for SAP customers!
 
Sincerely,
 
SAP Global Customer References and Advocates Team

entry.title: Re: Request failed with status code 503 in SAP BUILD CODE
entry.content:
Hello,

Even though Connection shows green light, I'd recommend you to check logs from cloud connector as most probable cause is some certicate error or that connectivity url is blocked by some proxy.
e.g. connectivity.eu10.apps.build.cloud.sap should be allowed for eu10 if you are using eu10. Replace with us10/ap10 etc depending on the datacenter you use.

Also I highly recommend using as few additional properties as possible. You should hardly ever use e.g. ForwardAuthToken.

-Pekka

entry.title: Re: Request to Enable Sales Areas in SAP CPQ Quote 2.0
entry.content:
It's not possible to enable any feature before the deployment (release) happens.
This feature will be available from the 2511 release as per the SAP CPQ roadmap.
 
You can apply for pre-upgrade testing - Pre-Upgrade Testing Offering | SAP Help Portal
This is the only way to get access to new version before the regular release.

entry.title: Re: Innovations in Master Data Governance with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025
entry.content:
Hi Anirban,

Thanks for your valuable feedback. Highly appreciated as always! Generally, the  Customer Influence program (https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/3497)  continues to be a key driver in shaping MDG. The program is in full swing and managed by the development team. It also includes requests related to central governance across domains, mass processing, consolidation and process analytics. Development plans derived from the program and relevant to upcoming feature pack stacks are yet to be published.

Beyond customer influence, the evolvement of cloud-ready mode (e.g. feature/process scope, additional domains) is another key driver. Please check the SAP Roadmap Explorer for updates on a continued basis.

entry.title: Stay Current with SAP SuccessFactors Performance and Goal Management: 2H 2025 Updates
entry.content:
Hello SAP SuccessFactors Community!

The second half of 2025 has brought a wave of exciting enhancements to Performance Management and Goal Management (PMGM). SAP continues to refine the user experience, introduce AI-powered capabilities, and phase out legacy features. Whether you're an administrator, manager, or employee, these updates are designed to make your performance management journey smoother and more intuitive.

Let me walk you through the key highlights across Goal Management, Performance Management, Calibration, 360 Reviews, and Continuous Performance Management.

The 2H 2025 release demonstrates SAP's commitment to:

  1. Modernization: Phasing out legacy experiences in favor of streamlined, intuitive interfaces
  2. Automation: Reducing administrative burden through auto-activation and mass operations
  3. AI Integration: Expanding AI-assisted capabilities across more areas
  4. Flexibility: Providing granular controls for data management and retention
  5. Collaboration: Enhancing cross-functional feedback and activity sharing

Goal Management

1. Purge Goals by Goal ID

Administrators now have more granular control over data management. You can delete specific performance and development goals using their Goal IDs through the Data Retention Management tool. This enhancement provides precision when cleaning up historical data.

How to use it:

  • Navigate to Admin Center ‚Üí Data Retention Management
  • Select either "Purge Goal" or "Purge Development Goal"
  • Choose the "Purge by Goal ID" option
  • Download the template, fill in the Goal IDs, and upload to initiate the purge

What's Changed:
In the current version, the Purge method field lists two options for purging goals: "Purge by goal plan template" and "Purge by goal ID". This gives you the flexibility to either purge all goals from a specific template or selectively purge individual goals.

In the previous version, there was only one option for purging goals: purging by goal plan template. This meant you had to delete all goals associated with a template, even if you only wanted to remove specific ones.

2. Upload, Update, and Download XML Templates in Manage Templates

A long-awaited feature! Admins can now manage XML templates directly within the Manage Templates tool. This includes performance forms, 360 forms, goal plans, and development goal plan templates.

Key capabilities:

  • Upload new templates
  • Update existing templates
  • Download templates for offline editing
  • View template revisions to track change history

Permission required: Admin Center ‚Üí Administrator Permissions ‚Üí Manage Templates ‚Üí Upload and Update XML Templates

What's Changed:
In the current version, you can upload, update, and download XML templates directly in the Manage Templates interface. This streamlines template management and gives you full control over your configurations.

In the previous version, you couldn't upload, update, or download XML templates in Manage Templates. You had to rely on Provisioning.

3. Import Goals for Target Population 

Security and data governance just got better. Users can now import goals only for their assigned target population, preventing unauthorized goal imports for users outside their scope.

Configuration requirement: You need the "Import Goals for Target Population" permission in addition to the standard Import Goals permission.

4. Minor Enhancements to the Latest Goal Management

Multiple User Experience Enhancements

SAP has made numerous improvements to the latest Goal Management experience, including:

  • Enhanced confirmation messages with clearer wording
  • Improved error messages for reserved field IDs
  • Warning messages are displayed as prominent message strips
  • Ability to select up to 100 loaded goals at once (up from 20)
  • Simplified permission model for sharing team goals
  • Enhanced printing patterns for goal comments and linked learning sections

5. Deprecation Alert: Legacy Goal Management (Deletion: December 31, 2026)

Mark your calendars! Legacy Goal Management reached End of Maintenance on May 17, 2024, and will be completely deleted on December 31, 2026. It's time to migrate to the latest Goal Management experience.

Important note: Customers using legacy Development Goals who haven't migrated from Job Description Manager to Job Profile Builder or Talent Intelligence Hub should prioritize their migration by 2H 2026.

Performance Management

1. Transfer Individual Talent Data from Inactive to Active Employment

Great news for rehires and employees returning from global assignments! The new Manage Individual Talent Data Transfer tool allows seamless transfer of talent data from inactive to active employment records.

Prerequisites:

  • Employee Central enabled for multiple employments
  • Enable the feature in Admin Center ‚Üí Company System and Logo Settings
  • Configure employment differentiators for accurate transfers

 

2. Enhanced Business Rules and Scenarios

SAP has introduced powerful new rule scenarios:

  • Change Field Visibility, Editability, and Required Status on Forms: Dynamically control field behavior based on conditions. Administrators can set specific fields on a form to visible or hidden, editable or read-only, and required or optional when certain conditions are met.
  • Add Review Steps Upon Form Routing: Automatically insert additional review steps when specific conditions are met. Admins can add one or multiple steps to the Modify stage of a form when it's being routed to the next step.
  • Get Count of Ratings: A new function to count goal, skill, or competency ratings matching specific criteria on a form.

3. Enhancements to Data Viewing in Full Profile

SAP has introduced more enhancements to the data viewing experience with Full Profile cards:

Trend Information Card Changes: In the previous version, the maximum value on the rating scale was shown together with the actual rating (e.g., 3-Meets Expectations/5-Outstanding). Now, the actual rating, maximum value, and minimum value are shown separately in three distinct columns for better clarity.

Calibration History Card Enhancement: The Calibration History card is now person-based rather than employment-based. It shows an employee's calibration sessions from all employments. Users with proper permissions can view all session records of an employee with multiple employments. When a user changes to a different employment, they can still access the same Calibration History card for that employee.

Configuration: Full Profile's redesigned data viewing experience is enabled by default through Admin Center ‚Üí Company System and Logo Settings ‚Üí Enable Full Profile for the latest People Profile.

4. Latest People Profile Card View on Performance Management Forms

When Full Profile is enabled, you can now configure card links in form templates using the format [[CARDLINK|<cardId>|<displayName>]]. Users will see button-style links that open the latest People Profile cards directly within forms.

Backward compatibility: Existing block links from legacy templates can also redirect to the updated card view when certain conditions are met.

In the current version, you can add card links to the form, which will display the latest card view. Block links that meet specific conditions will also display the card view

5. Comprehensive Form Experience Enhancements

The latest Performance Management form experience now includes:

  • EZ Rater support: View official ratings and employee ratings side by side with rating gaps. In the legacy experience, EZ Rater displayed ratings side by side. In the latest experience, the side-by-side view and rating gaps are automatically available through the Gap Analysis feature. EZ Rater can be enabled for users without Gap Analysis access.
  • Enhanced printing capabilities:
    • All form content including goal comments and learning activities can now be printed
    • Custom layout printing is now supported - users can choose between Custom Layout and Standard Layout
    • Form snapshots (accessed through reports or audit trails) now have a dedicated Print button
  • Improved side panel: Now displays unofficial ratings, expected ratings, and rating gaps alongside the main page
  • Goal status field color: When text colors for goal status are configured in the goal plan template, those colors now apply to the goal status on the form
  • Competency rating help text: Added clarifying help text for read-only rating fields in competencies with behaviors, explaining that ratings are calculated based on behavior ratings
  • Optimized Team Ranker popover: Maximum height is now limited to 50% of the screen for better usability with long team member lists
  • Better experience for proxy users: When proxy users don't have full proxy rights, unavailable module content is hidden with a clear warning message explaining required permissions, rather than showing empty sections
  • Cleaner read-only interface: Action buttons (like Create Activity, Manage Learning) are now hidden when users access read-only forms or sections, eliminating confusion

5. Legacy Form Experience Deprecation (Deletion: November 20, 2026)

The legacy Performance Management form experience reached End of Development on November 14, 2025, and will be deleted on November 20, 2026. Plan your migration to the latest experience accordingly.

6. Mass Route Ungrouped Forms to a Specific Step (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Administrators can now mass route multiple ungrouped forms to a specific step, provided they share the same template and route map. This feature significantly reduces administrative overhead when managing large numbers of forms.

7. AI-Assisted Performance Insights with Adjusted Time Frame (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

To improve relevancy and performance, AI-assisted insights now apply a one-year upper limit to data sources:

  • Review periods ‚â§ 1 year: All data from the period is used
  • Review periods > 1 year: All form comments plus one year of data from other sources

8. Granular Data Retention and Purge Capabilities (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Administrators now have fine-grained control over data retention policies:

  • Configure retention periods by specific form templates
  • Define retention periods in days (in addition to months and years)
  • Preview which forms will be excluded from purge operations and understand why

When setting up DRTM Performance Reviews purge requests in Admin Center  Data Retention Management, administrators can specify templates in a purge request to purge forms that use them. In preview reports of DRTM Performance Reviews purge requests, besides forms to be purged, administrators can now see forms that are excluded and the reasons why they're excluded.

9. Enhanced AI-Assisted Writing (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

AI-assisted writing actions (Generate Comments and Improve My Feedback) are now available for goals, extending the capability beyond skills, competencies, and behaviors.

Calibration

1. Auto-Activate Calibration Sessions

Administrators can now schedule automatic activation of calibration sessions using the new "Auto-activate sessions" setting in calibration templates. The feature includes:

  • Template-level or session-level activation dates
  • New job type: "Auto-Activate Calibration Sessions on Planned Date"
  • Optional enforcement mode that removes subjects with validation errors to allow activation
  • Email notifications detailing activation results

2. Exclude Contingent Workers When Creating Calibration Sessions

A new global setting automatically removes contingent workers from calibration sessions during creation, streamlining session setup for core employees.

  • Users can create sessions using the Manage Calibration Sessions tool. When you search for users through the org chart or advanced search and then add the selected users to participant and subjects, a warning message will appear if any contingent workers are included, indicating which ones have been removed.
  • Managers create sessions directly on the landing page of Calibration.
  • You create multiple calibration sessions using a validated CSV file.

However, any contingent worker already added to a session will remain included when you activate those sessions.

3. Rating Change History Available in Calibration Sessions

Transparency gets a boost! Users can now track all rating changes within calibration sessions through a dedicated Rating Change History page, showing old ratings, new ratings, who made changes, and when.

4. Comments from Other Calibration Sessions Now Counted

The comment feature now shows total counts from both the current session and other sessions based on the same template. View comments separately in "From This Session" and "From Other Sessions" tabs.

Configuration: Enable "Roll up comments from other sessions based on the same template" in the calibration template settings.

5. Additional Calibration Enhancements

  • Remove inactive subjects from all calibration sessions
  • Display extra fields for subjects in both Bin and Matrix views
  • Bin width adjustments now save automatically

360 Reviews

1. Add Link to Detailed 360 Report in Email Notifications

Users can now access Detailed 360 Reports directly from email notifications using the new tag [[PM360_DETAILED_REPORT_URL]]. This eliminates the need to navigate through the system to find reports.

2. Multiple Email Reminders for Upcoming Steps (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Administrators can now schedule multiple reminder notifications ahead of 360 review step due dates. Use the new "Series Due Notification Dates" option to enter comma-separated values for multiple reminders (e.g., 2,3,5,7 for reminders 2, 3, 5, and 7 days before the due date).

3. Hide Radar Charts Option (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

A new switch in Form Template Settings allows you to hide radar charts on Detailed 360 Reports when attribute names are lengthy and affect readability.

4. Minor Enhancements Include:

  • Improved spacing in Competency and Objective sections
  • Retention of original category information for re-added participants
  • Links to generate development goals in Assisted 360 Reviews Insights
  • Enhanced error messages for troubleshooting
  • Behavior information now included in AI-generated comments

5. Deprecation Alert: Spell Check Feature (Deletion: May 14, 2026)

The Spell Check feature reached End of Maintenance on May 17, 2024, and will be deleted on May 14, 2026.

Key Dates:

  • End of Development: November 17, 2023
  • End of Maintenance: May 17, 2024
  • Deletion: May 14, 2026

Plan to adopt alternative spell-checking methods before the deletion date.

Continuous Performance Management

1. Enhanced Word Counting and Increased Length Limits (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Word counts now use characters instead of bytes, with extended length limits:

  • Channel invitation notes: 4000 characters
  • Activity names: 4000 characters
  • Activity comments: 4000 characters
  • Achievement names: 4000 characters
  • Meeting notes: 2000 characters
  • Feedback answers: 4000 characters

2. Feedback Functionality Supported for More Activities (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Users can now request and view feedback on activities in any channels where they are participants, not just manager-direct report relationships. This enables feedback collection across temporary assignments and cross-functional projects.

3. Expanded AI-Assisted Writing

AI-assisted writing is now available in more text areas:

  • Continuous Performance: Activity names, updates, achievement names, meeting notes, discussion topics, channel invitation notes
  • Continuous Feedback: Feedback topics and questions

4. Enhancements to Microsoft Teams Integration

The Create Activity quick action in Microsoft Teams now includes:

  • New Link buttons to connect activities with multiple performance and development goals
  • Ability to search for goals or link to displayed goal plans
  • More flexibility than the previous dropdown approach

5. Share Activities Across Channels

Channel participants can now share activities across multiple channels for seamless collaboration. Features include:

  • Control over whether target channel owners can view and comment
  • Visual indicators for shared activities
  • Reportable sharing records via Story reports
  • Activity Sharing and Captured Activity Sharing data tables

Please feel free to share your ideas and questions in the comment box of this blog. I‚Äôd be glad to share what I know with you. Also, do share your thoughts on the latest changes, and the features you valued the most. Share this blog with your colleagues.

Thank you!!

entry.title: Re: Commerce Automation - MIRO Invoice to SAP Business ne...
entry.content: I am Sorry but that is not correct. You can totally send SAP backend generated invoices from Backend to SBN. You generally do this in order to give visibility to your supplier about his invoice statuses. The interface to do this is called "CC-invoice" or "Copy invoice"....And for info, in my company, we are doing this since several years so I know it is working... üôÇ
